author: Lingling Wei
title: American Express Advances in Effort to Access China Market
text:
BEIJING—American Express Co. cleared a hurdle in its yearslong effort to operate in China, potentially becoming the first U.S. card network to receive permission to offer services in the Chinese market.
China’s central bank informed the New York-based card issuer that it would “formally accept” its application to clear and settle domestic bank-card transactions, an AmEx spokesman said. The firm has applied to do so by forming a joint venture with a Chinese mobile-payment provider, Lianlian Group, the spokesman said. The People’s...
